header.title: neuroConstruct: Software for developing biologically realistic 3D neural networks

figure.alt: Network model of granule cell layer of cerebellum

section.title: Introduction
section.p: neuroConstruct has been developed in the Silver Lab in the Department of Physiology at UCL. neuroConstruct has been designed to simplify development of complex networks of biologically realistic neurons, i.e. models incorporating dendritic morphologies and realistic cell membrane conductances. It is implemented in Java and generates script files for the NEURON and GENESIS simulators. It uses the latest NeuroML specifications for neuronal information exchange including MorphML and ChannelML.

section.title: What is neuroConstruct?
section.p: Some of the key features of neuroConstruct are:

ul.li: neuroConstruct can import morphology files in GENESIS, NEURON, Neurolucida, SWC and MorphML format for inclusion in network models
Creation of networks of conductance based neurons, positioned in 3D
Complex connectivity patterns between cell groups can be specified for the networks
Simulations can be run on the NEURON or GENESIS platforms
Electrophysiological cellular mechanisms (synapses/channel mechanisms) can be imported from native script files (*.mod or *.g) or created from templates using ChannelML
Automatic generation of code to record simulation data and visualisation/analysis of data in neuroConstruct
Recorded simulation runs can be viewed and managed through the Simulation Browser interface

section.title: What isn't neuroConstruct?

ul.li: neuroConstruct is not a replacement for neural network simulators like NEURON or GENESIS

section.p: These packages have sophisticated environments for creating neuronal simulations from scratch, and controlling all aspects of the simulation run. neuroConstruct automates the generation of script files for these platforms, and provides a framework for creating conductance based neuronal models, creating, visualising and analysing networks of cells in 3D, managing simualtions and analysing network firing behaviour.

section.title: Presentations
section.p: The application was presented at the 2004 NEURON Simulator Meeting at Northwestern University in May 2004. A tutorial "Building 3D Network Models with neuroConstruct" was given at the World Association of Modelers, First Annual Biologically Accurate Modeling Meeting in March 2005. A poster entitled "Simulation of Synaptic Integration in Biologically Realistic 3D Neuronal Networks" has been presented at Neuroscience 2005. There was a poster presentation on the latest developments with neuroConstruct at CNS*2006 in Edinburgh.
